component_utils¶

Functions¶

def areEqual()

def getComponentsFromShape()

def getDifference()

def getIntersection()

def getUnion()

Description¶

Operate on components in Maya.

Retrival¶

The OpenMaya API represents components as an encapsulation of indices and a component type. Depending on the component type, the encapsulation will either be a single indexed list (eg. vertices) or a double index list (eg. surface CVs).

  • See msTools.core.maya.constants.COMPONENT_CONSTANT_CLASS_MAPPING for a mapping of component types to function set types capable of producing the encapsulation.
  • For example OpenMaya.MFnSingleIndexedComponent is capable of producing an object that encapsulates the vertices of a shape node.

To retrieve component indices from a shape there are a range of component iterators available in the OpenMaya API.

  • See msTools.core.maya.constants.COMPONENT_CONSTANT_ITERATOR_CLASS_MAPPING for a mapping of component types to component iterators.
  • The only component type which does not have a respective iterator is OpenMaya.MFn.kCurveCVComponent.
  • Curve CVs do not require an iterator due to the simplicity of their arrangement.

Selection¶

To select components through the OpenMaya API an OpenMaya.MSelectionList can be used. Selections are made via a two-element tuple of (OpenMaya.MDagPath, OpenMaya.MObject).

  • The OpenMaya.MDagPath specifies a path to a specific instance of a shape node.
  • The OpenMaya.MObject represents an encapsulation of the components to be selected for the shape instance.
msTools.core.maya.component_utils.areEqual(componentA, componentB)¶

Check if two component objects are equivalent in terms of indices and component type.

Parameters:
  • componentA (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a component object.
  • componentB (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a component object.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If componentA or componentB do not reference components.
Returns:

bool – True if componentA is equivalent to componentB in terms of indices and component type, otherwise False.
msTools.core.maya.component_utils.getComponentsFromShape(shape, componentType=550)¶

Return the components of a shape for a specific component type.

The result can be used to select the components of shape via an OpenMaya.MSelectionList.

Parameters:
  • shape (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a shape node of type mesh, surface or curve.
  • componentType (int, optional) – Component type constant from OpenMaya.MFn, compatible with shape. See msTools.core.maya.constants.SHAPE_CONSTANT_COMPONENT_CONSTANTS_MAPPING for a mapping of valid shape types to valid component type constants. Defaults to OpenMaya.MFn.kMeshVertComponent.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If the componentType is not compatible with shape.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If shape is neither a mesh, surface nor curve.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper of the component indices and componentType.
msTools.core.maya.component_utils.getDifference(componentA, componentB)¶

Return the difference of componentB subtracted from componentA. The difference contains all elements of componentA which are not in componentB.

Parameters:
  • componentA (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a component object.
  • componentB (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a component object.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If componentA or componentB do not reference components.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If componentA and componentB do not have the same component types.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper of a component object representing the difference of componentB subtracted from componentA.
msTools.core.maya.component_utils.getIntersection(componentA, componentB)¶

Return the intersection of componentA and componentB. The intersection contains all elements which are common to both componentA and componentB.

Parameters:
  • componentA (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a component object.
  • componentB (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a component object.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If componentA or componentB do not reference components.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If componentA and componentB do not have the same component types.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper of a component object representing the intersection of componentA and componentB.
msTools.core.maya.component_utils.getUnion(componentA, componentB)¶

Return the union of componentA with componentB. The union contains all elements of componentA and componentB.

Parameters:
  • componentA (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a component object.
  • componentB (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a component object.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If componentA or componentB do not reference components.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If componentA and componentB do not have the same component types.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrapper of a component object representing the union of componentA with componentB.
